citation.article-title: Aeromicrobium ginsengisoli sp. nov., isolated from a ginseng field.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Aeromicrobium ginsengisoli sp. nov.
Aeromicrobium ginsengisoli (gin.sen.gi.so′li. N.L. n. ginsengum ginseng; L. n. solum soil; N.L. gen. n. ginsengisoli from ginseng soil).
Gram-positive, aerobic, non-motile cocci, 0.5–1.2×0.3–0.4 μm after growth on R2A agar (Difco) at 30 °C for 5 days.
Colonies on R2A agar after 5 days are white and circular.
The optimal growth temperature and pH are 30 °C and pH 7, with a growth range of pH 5.0–8.5.
Grows in a salt concentration of 3 %, but growth is weak above 4 %.
Reduces nitrate to nitrite, but not to nitrogen gas.
The test for oxidase activity is positive and the test for catalase activity is negative.

Produces β-glucosidase, protease and β-galactosidase, but not arginine dihydrolase, cellulase, chitinase, DNase, α-glucosidase, lysine decarboxylase, ornithine decarboxylase, tryptophan deaminase, urease or xylanase.

Assimilates 3-hydroxybutyrate, acetate, fumarate, gluconate, malate, propionate, pyruvate, succinate, n-valerate, d-arabinose, l-arabinose, cellobiose, d-fructose, d-fucose, d-galactose, d-glucose, d-lactose, d-lyxose, maltose, d-mannose, l-rhamnose, l-sorbose, sucrose, trehalose, d-xylose, dulcitol, ethanol, glycerol, inositol, l-alanine, l-asparagine, glutamate, glutamine, l-leucine, l-phenylalanine, l-proline, l-serine, l-tryptophan, l-tyrosine, N-acetyl-d-glucosamine and inulin.

Does not assimilate 2-ketogluconate, 3-hydroxybenzoate, 4-hydroxybenzoate, 5-ketogluconate, adipate, benzoate, caprate, citrate, formate, glutarate, itaconate, lactate, maleic acid, malonate, oxalate, phenyl acetate, suberate, tartrate, l-fucose, melibiose, raffinose, d-ribose, l-xylose, d-adonitol, myo-inositol, d-mannitol, methanol, d-sorbitol, xylitol, l-arginine, l-aspartate, l-cysteine, l-glycine, l-histidine, l-isoleucine, l-lysine, l-methionine, l-threonine, l-valine, salicin, glycogen or dextran.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 66.8 mol% as determined by HPLC.

Major cellular fatty acids include C16 : 0 (32.7 %), 10-methyl C18 : 0 (20.6 %) and C18 : 0 (12.9 %), while minor saturated fatty acids C17 : 0 (3.2 %), 10-methyl C17 : 0 (2.4 %) and 10-methyl C19 : 0 (3.1 %) are also present.
The type strain, Gsoil 098T (=KCTC 19207T =JCM 14732T =GBS 39T), was isolated from soil of a ginseng field in Daejeon, South Korea.
